instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No TP/KB
threads.message: Hi. I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no Trackpad/Keyboard in Operating System except for power button. Both keyboard and trackpad will work pre - O.S. External KB/Mouse will work fine. Have tried with multiple Operating Systems. Thank you. Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No TP/KB
threads.message: Check SPI lines on trackpad connector an resistors <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R4853</RESISTOR>.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No TP/KB
threads.message:
Hi. Thank you.

pn 2 - 0
pn 7 - Jumps everywhere between .015 - .005
pn 9 - .003
pn 11, 12, 13 - Jumps everywehere between 3.3 - 2.7

<RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR> 33.8 Ohm
<RESISTOR>R4853</RESISTOR> 33.8 Ohm

Thanks again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No TP/KB
threads.message:
I mean <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R4851</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R4852</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R4853</RESISTOR>......

This is water damage??? Inpect for corrosion on connector, trackpad side and LB side....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No TP/KB
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R4851</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R4852</RESISTOR> are within 33 Ohms as well.

Areas are pretty clean. Aside from discoloration on via's.  [URL]https://goo.gl/photos/qHkf4st1zWA4fJaW6[/URL]

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No TP/KB
threads.message:
Put back together. It seems to be working again.

pn 2 - 0
pn 7 - 0
pn 9 - .003
pn 11 - 3.297
pn 12 - 3.326
pn 13 - 3.309

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No TP/KB
threads.message: The usual bad TP cable/corrosion in the connectors.
